Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: hawksblue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I was in a pinch (flight canceled and rebooked the following day). I was just looking for a basic place to lay my head for the short night and Jet Motel was exactly what I needed. I didn't have much with me as my check-in luggage was still at the airport. The clerk was helpful in directing me to a local convenience store down the way to grab some essentials. I had a good night's sleep and they got me back to the airport on time. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a good value in the airport area, all the other places I looked at were much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I should have slept in the terminal”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer O
Reviews.Content: I cannot warn travelers enough---STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! It is old and disgusting! We got stuck in Seattle late at night and had to be back to the airport early in the morning. Not wanting to spend a lot of money, we opted for the low price....bad move! Despite all the tacky "no smoking" signs, people clearly smoke in the rooms. But that's not the worst part. The rooms are old, smelly, and just feel dirty. The bed was horrible. The walls are so thin you can hear the tv on in the room next door. The bathroom was DISGUSTING! I was so tired and wanted a shower but I refused because it was so old and gross. I think taking a shower would have made me feel dirtier. Bottom line, spend the extra $30 to stay in a place where you can actually sleep and shower. Honestly, the benches in the terminal would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Service is horible, Beds are hard and shuttle is miserable.”
Reviews.Author: travelswithbicycle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the worst I have stayed in. It is in a great location for the airport but it is like you are in nasty place with simple people running the place. They have no computer set up for managing shuttle service. This resulted in extended delays waiting at the airport to be picked up for return to the hotel. The staff was then rude and complained about the cost to send the shuttle driver to get me. I travel over 30 times a year for business and Jet motel used to get my parking business but not anymore. As I waited in the cold for them to come I watched several other parking services make 3 trips through the airport. Use wally, or master park. Jet just doesn't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to Satay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: JanetOlympia
Reviews.Content: This was the worst flea bag motel we have ever even seen let alone had to stay in! Not even a plug in in the bathroom to do my hair. No amenities at all! The shower looked like it was removed from the county jail facitilty! WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Pleasant Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Shadal
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport and perfect for the traveler. Big Rooms

Reviews.Title: “Well, better than sleping in the terminal...”
Reviews.Author: JRDelirious
Reviews.Content: A late-night missed connection and a rerouting the next day meant taking what was out there. For $60 it's pretty much all that's mentioned in the other reviews: an old-time little cheap motel, the sort you thought would have long been wiped out from this location, but it sodiers on and being 5 minutes from the terminal does count for something. Everything's cheap, worn and old; must acknowledge very friendly staff. TV is superbasic local. The conventional-key door (cheapo knob and no chain, as mentioned) was a major throwback! Must note, this time they did not have the "trolley" shuttle, just a conventional van.They have obviously made very good use of the website and the SeaTac arrivals hotel-phone screens, where they are one of the first listings, to catch business.

Reviews.Title: “el-Dump-o”
Reviews.Author: doug_8
Reviews.Content: Pay an extra $15-30 bucks and stay somewhere else!! The price was good--and that is about it. I mean it. Tv is small and hardly works. The couch is old and can be easily broken if you sat down too hard. Rain leak stains on ceiling not mended with drywall compound Nasty remarks wrote in cabinets & on lamp shade by past vacationers. Included a drawing for better understanding of what they meant when they wrote "[-]". Did I mention the used underwear in the kitchen cabinet? Oh yeah...pretty classy place. The door to the room was very cheap! If someone wanted in your room they could have very easily kicked it in. No wi-fi, no breakfast--Denny's is next door we took photos--I will put them on if I can log back on here

Reviews.Title: “OLD?!! That's an understatement!= Their website very misleading!”
Reviews.Author: kshy
Reviews.Content: I booked through the motel's website, which clearly states the place was "recently renovated and soundproofed." Great - for $65 bucks a night w/ my AARP discount. I called the 800 number to confirm the free parking and 24-hour shuttle service, then I booked a room here to stay 1 night. Based on Trip Advisor reviews I wasn't expecting a lot. Well, this place certainly exceeded my low expectations! (I only wish we had pictures because you won't believe this!) The good: Yes, the rooms are large - the double queen room my daughters and I stayed in was actually a 1 bedroom suite w/a full kitchen. The sheets, towels, fixtures, and appliances appeared to be clean, but very worn. And yes, the front-desk staff and shuttle driver were nice & helpful. Also, it is only a 5 minute ride to the airport. Denny's next door is convenient, too. The bad: Extremely noisy due to air conditioning units not being well-sealed to the outside. Fortunately, we did not need the A/C, as the knobs kept falling off and the units looked filthy inside. The second floor balcony was dirty and smelled of ciggie smoke, even though we had a non-smoking room. The full kitchen had no silverware (even plastic would've been nice) or even paper plates - made it difficult to heat & eat our Denny's leftovers @ 3:30 a.m. No dishwashing soap either. The TV barely worked, but we made do by not watching. The TV cable was not even hooked into the wall - the plate was off exposing a big hole in the wall! The ugly: It gets worse, folks! The baseboard heating units were falling apart, leaving wiring exposed (thank goodness my kids are teens!) and gaps in the walls. I could not tell if the carpet was clean, so none of us took off our shoes. My youngest wanted to sleep on the sagging, ancient couch, so I made her bring up the sleeping bag from the car to lay on - again, no idea how long since the furniture had been cleaned. Tiles had fallen off the walls in the bathroom, and the grab - bar in the tub had been removed! No anti-slip strips in the tub either. Yes, Room 21 was barely habitable. Had we not arrived after 8 pm, with a 4 am airport delivery of my eldest to the airport, I'd have left. Oh, did I mention the thin doors and KEYED lock with no chain or anything? I slept not a wink that night! PLUS, they have a "strictly no refund" policy. Never again will I risk my family's health and safety for lack of spending an extra 50 or 60 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: motohachi
Reviews.Content: It's a old budget hotel. I stayed 2 seprate occations, and both rooms I stayed were very roomy. It has shuttle service to/from airport and very convenient. If you need to stay one night near the airport and doesn't mind a bit old furnitures, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Cali78
Reviews.Content: For an inexpensive motel near the airport - it's pretty much what you'd expect. The building is old, but clean and the decor was almost retro. It's a good, inexpensive option for a late arrival or early departure. My one complaint - the pillows are very hard and lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Jet is Campy; Restaurant iffy at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Love the down to earth, crusty yet prideful attitude over at Jet! Interest in "unique experience" required -- would stay there again with my family at the beginning of our next visit flying in from airport but staying there the last night was an error. Unfortunately, the in-house restaurant -- Happy Teriyaki, or something like that -- BIG MISTAKE -- service took more than 1 hour between order and food, and when it came the salmon was so suspect we returned it (and paid -- no apologies or thanks from manager) and went where we should have gone in the first place at 9 pm with a small child -- Denny's next door. In fact a Denny's next door is possibly the coolest feature of Jet Hotel (well, that and it is directly across from Seattle's Sea-Tak Airport -- great staff there too, and refreshingly decent food. For a more upscale restaurant there's a Hilton just 2 blocks away with fine dining incl that delish local Salmon...

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot!”
Reviews.Author: elea
Reviews.Content: This little place is perfect for a family stay the night before an early flight. Nothing fancy but very clean. Cute little red trolly bus to take you over to the terminal- and antique cars in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “good deal, old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price and with the expectation that you will be staying there because its across the street from the airport, its worth it. Not a chain, been there a long time, some interesting front desk people, but the room was clean and they'll drive you to the airport in their trolley-bus.

HotelInfo.Name: Jet Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 17300 International Blvd. / Pacific Hwy. S, Seattle, WA 98188
